definition: to quarrel/dispute
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise

sentences.english: The brawl in the street could be heard in the house nearby .
sentences.chinese: 在附近的房子里都能听到街上的争吵声。

sentences.english: She keeps after her boyfriend all day long and he can't bear it any more.
sentences.chinese: 她整天都在与她的男朋友争吵，他没法再忍受下去了。

sentences.english: Have you ever walked into a room after people have been fighting?
sentences.chinese: 你曾走进人们刚争吵过之后的房间吗？

sentences.english: Better to live in a desert than with a quarrelsome and ill-tempered wife.
sentences.chinese: 宁可住在旷野，不与争吵使气的妇人同住。

sentences.english: The two brothers quickly came to blows during their quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 这俩兄弟互相争吵，很快就变成了拳脚相加。

sentences.english: As an argument broke out in Chinese, we felt unbelievably awkward.
sentences.chinese: 一场中国话的争吵爆发时，我们感到难以置信的尴尬。

sentences.english: The quarrel between them rose from a misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 他俩之间的争吵是由于误会而造成的。

sentences.english: Breaking up can stop us from quarrelling.
sentences.chinese: 分手才能停止我们之间的争吵。

sentences.english: Family Quarrel The young newly- weds quarreled.
sentences.chinese: 家庭的争吵一对年轻的新婚夫妇吵架了。

sentences.english: He decided to square himself with his wife after their quarrel.
sentences.chinese: 争吵之后，他决定与他的妻子言归于好。

sentences.english: From the room came a sound of quarrelling.
sentences.chinese: 争吵声从那个房间里传了出来。
他们因花费的事争吵不休。

sentences.english: One afternoon I heard Imelda and her daughter arguing in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 一天下午，我听到伊梅尔达和她的女儿在厨房争吵。

sentences.english: Deeply moved by the story, the excited people stopped quarrelling with each other.
sentences.chinese: 激动的人们被那个故事深深地感动了，停止了争吵。

sentences.english: I was responsible for creating a huge affray.
sentences.chinese: 我对那场大争吵是有责任的。

definition: to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to quarrel/to have a row/quarrel/CL:頓|顿[dun4]
noisy/raucous/to shout and scream
to be at loggerheads/to have a falling out
to quarrel
to bicker/to squabble/to quarrel
to disagree/dissent
to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise
to shout and scream (idiom); to kick up a fuss/to make a scene
to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
contradiction/CL:個|个[ge4]/conflicting views/contradictory
to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
altercation/wrangle/angry argument
corner of the mouth
conflict/to conflict/clash of opposing forces/collision (of interests)/contention
